page.title: 13CROSCOMBE
page.content: The village lies in the{Sheppey Valley with the remain of its former {water-powerered textile mills}still visible. The older houses are built of stone and surround the church and cross with the modern houses extending along the road and further up the valley sides. It is a very charming scene rather reminiscent of a Cornish fishing village. There is an old manor house and opposite a former textile mill which until recently retained its water wheel. Unfortunately between them lies the main Wells to Shepton Mallet road which carries considerable numbers of cars and lorries through Croscombe's narrow, winding main street. The church tower gives glorious views across the pantile roofs of the houses. A local feature is the houses of{conglomerate with black mortar.
